intro: Schmaltzia scaberula, commonly known as the rough schmaltzia, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Schmaltzia scaberula is notable for its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a rough texture.
